Posts.Content: hI, I just found out that I have Infiltrating Doctal carcinoma, stage IV, grade two and estrogen positive.  I am 44 years old in pretty good health until I fractured two back bones five month ago that give me a lot of pain and limit my mobility.  I will be starting chemo soon.  I would appreciate any advise for those with this disease and what treatments have helped you.  I am terrified that I won't be around for my 11 year old daughter and need to fight this thing the best way possible.  Thanks for your advice.   Jan
Posts.Title: INFILTRATING DOCTAL CARCINOMA

Posts.Content: Hi, I am awaiting my results form a breast biopsy but was told I probable have stage iv breast cancer that has gone to my bones. I currently have a lower back fravture which brought along other tests to see why this happened. My mamagram came out ok but my CAT scan showed suspicion in my breast along with 6-8 places in my spine, ribs, pelvic, etc. I have been reading a lot I want to start on treatment. I have been suffering with my broken bone in my back for 5 months and feel a lot of pain in the places the CAT scan showed disease. Should I start taking Immunopower, Ultramet, Polymvul or is there soething better. I think the doctors will give me a gloomy outlook but I want to start fighting back right now. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
Posts.Title: diagnoised with stage iv breast cancer metastasized to bones in spine and pelvic
